Date:   Tue Jul 30 16:06:38 2019 -0300

    Fix issue #352
    
    the site url of nhentai books was being affected by this bug because result.setUrl using the gallery url to get it's value what this entail is the following:
    -Before correction:
    https://nhentai.net/g/99991/1/
    became
    https://nhentai.net/g/9999
    -After correction:
    https://nhentai.net/g/99991/1/
    becomes
    https://nhentai.net/g/99991/
    i tested downloading books that had the code 99991, 11, 1 and the one reported by the user 176361 all of them downloaded without errors and redirected in queue and download library to the correct book.

commit 8d7458a53e2a39b94b7db225b3107809009fc0cd
Author: ArturRA <phoenixrebirth1324@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Jul 21 05:24:29 2019 -0300

    Fix issues reported by Android Studio analyze
    
    * Add sonarcloud suppression rule
    
    Add sonarcloud suppression rule for deprecated class/method, where their use is needed.
    Reference this link https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33379959/honoring-suppresswarnings-with-the-sonar-checkstyle-plugin
    
    * Make multiline TODO properly on the TODO searcher
    
    By indenting the extra lines of a TODO it properly shows on the TODO navigator
    Reference link: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2018/09/intellij-idea-2018-3-early-access-program-is-open/
    the change is in IntelliJ IDEA 2018.3 but it also works on android studio
    
    * Fix issues reported by Sonar
    
    The attribute booksPerPage type is first declared as protected int there it's wrong to change it's type later.
    Two cases of the switch case do the same thing we can make them fall through to not repeat code.
    
    * Switch name.size() > 0 to !name.isEmpty()
    
    * Attempt to change keySet() to entrySet()
    
    When only the keys from a map are needed in a loop, iterating the keySet makes sense. But when both the key and the value are needed, it's more efficient to iterate the entrySet, which will give access to both the key and value, instead.
    
    * Change readability of variables
    
    * Merge the if statement with the enclosing one
    
    * Remove useless curly braces around statement
    
    * Replace equals() + toLowerCase() with equalsIgnoreCase()
    
    * Remove the parentheses around the "result" and "throwable"
    
    Parentheses should be removed from a single lambda input parameter when its type is inferred
    
    * Remove the parentheses and useless curly braces
    
    * All these attributes can be changed to static
    
    * Fix my mistake on booksPerPage
    
    Rename the local variable from booksPerPage to settingsBooksPerPage
    
    * Reordered the modifiers and changed attribute readability
    
    * Rollback change from keySet() to entrySet()
    
    * Fix html tag
    
    Reference link: https://www.rapidtables.com/web/html/mailto.html
    
    * Remove unnecessary if
    
    Since the minSdkVersion is 19 it will never be less then 19 making both those if statements useless
    
    * Change layout_marginLeft/Right with layout_marginStart/End
    
    Since the current minSdkVersion is higher then 17 we can start using only layout_marginStart/End and paddingStart/End
    
    * Private resources should not be referenced
    
    they may not be present everywhere, and even where they are they may disappear without notice.
    
    * Field can be converted to a local variable
    
    It is only used inside OkHttpClient getInstance().
    
    * Change "UTF-8" to StandardCharsets.UTF_8
    
    Since the minSdkVersion is 19 we can instead use StandardCharsets.UTF_8 on those places. Reason being "It's more strongly typed and has compile time checks built in." Link: https://github.com/apache/incubator-heron/issues/1598
    
    * Unnecessary call to Character.toString

commit 679a883480eb13a26e315754853b1c292e0c6b8a
Author: Cat Knight <phoenixrebirth1324@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Jul 20 16:31:03 2019 -0300

    Attempt to change keySet() to entrySet()
    
    When only the keys from a map are needed in a loop, iterating the keySet makes sense. But when both the key and the value are needed, it's more efficient to iterate the entrySet, which will give access to both the key and value, instead.

commit 1fe08039e9d5c8c77a11e590b6c242ab8994113e
Author: Subaru "Shiro" Tashiro <wightwulf1944@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jan 19 23:54:47 2016 +0800

    Fixed fabs hiding on new page load
    
    Loading a new page can change the scroll position to the maximum position if the new page is shorter than the previous page. This causes "webView.canScrollVertically(1)" to return false which causes the fabs to hide.

commit b57f22fb4f9631b9e044d76b3ab01b7d545e0504
Author: Subaru "Shiro" Tashiro <wightwulf1944@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Jan 18 00:54:04 2016 +0800

    Webview UX fixes
    
    removed use of assert statement. (see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1957645/when-to-use-an-assertion-and-when-to-use-an-exception)
    
    removed use of v21 qualifier for layout. (Toolbar elevation is 4dp when not specified on some platforms and 0dp on some other platforms. Specifying elevation makes it consistent on all platforms with no performance loss)
    
    returned FABs to bottom right.
    Applied hide on scroll to bottom behavior on FABs.
    Added toolbar refresh action for convenience. (Refresh without scrolling to top)
